channel.title: Comments on: Standards Based Grading(SBG) and The SUMPRODUCT Command
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/10/14/standards-based-gradingsbg-and-the-sumproduct-command/#comment-321">Bob Kuhn</a>.
Hi Bob,
I'm counting the number of questions students have perfectly correct. For students with most questions perfectly correct, I'll generally mark them as proficient. For students with most incorrect, I'll probably mark them closer to a 1 or 2. In both cases, I take another look at their exam to make sure the proficiency level I'm giving them is consistent with their level of work on the exam.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Bob Kuhn.

Hi Bob,

I’m counting the number of questions students have perfectly correct. For students with most questions perfectly correct, I’ll generally mark them as proficient. For students with most incorrect, I’ll probably mark them closer to a 1 or 2. In both cases, I take another look at their exam to make sure the proficiency level I’m giving them is consistent with their level of work on the exam.

item.title: By: Bob Kuhn
item.dc:creator: Bob Kuhn
item.description: Evan, with multiple questions aligned to specific standards, how are you determining mastery for the standard?
item.content:encoded: Evan, with multiple questions aligned to specific standards, how are you determining mastery for the standard?
